required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Ideal Position for Arthrodesis of the Metacarpophalangeal Joint of the Thumb
clinical_study.official_title: The Ideal Position for Arthrodesis of the Metacarpophalangeal Joint of the Thumb

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to measure the position of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb during key-pinch, tripod-pinch and opposition-pinch in normal volunteers, to determine the optimal position of metacarpophalangeal joint arthrodesis.

detailed_description.textblock:
The aim of the study is to measure the position of the metacarpophalangeal (MCP) joint of the thumb during key-pinch, tripod-pinch and opposition-pinch in normal volunteers, to determine the optimal position of metacarpophalangeal joint arthrodesis.
The force will be measured in three positions (key-pinch, tripod-pinch and opposition-pinch). Also measured is the degree of flexion of the MCP joint of the thumb. The mobility of the MCP joint of the thumb in maximum flexion and extension will also be measured. A total of about 300 healthy volunteers will be examined, with no history of trauma or disease to tendons or joints of the thumbs and between the ages of 18 and 40. The sponsor of this study is Professor Nadine Hollevoet. Master students of medicine from the faculty of medicine and health sciences will be part of the research team.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: measurement of the joint mobility and the force of the thumb

primary_outcome.measure: pinch strength of the thumb (in kilograms force)
primary_outcome.description: pinch strength of the thumb in key-pinch, opposition-pinch and tripod-pinch

primary_outcome.measure: the angle of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb (in degrees)
primary_outcome.description: the angle of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb (in degrees) during maximal force in the three pinch positions

primary_outcome.measure: range of motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb (in degrees)
primary_outcome.description: range of motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb (in degrees) measuring maximal flexion and maximal extension of the joint

arm_group.description: normal volunteers between 18 and 40 years old, men and women. Measurement of the range of motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint with a goniometer and pinch strength of the thumb with a dynamometer

intervention.intervention_name: measurement of range of motion and strength
intervention.description: measurement of range of motion (goniometer) and strength (dynamometer) of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age between 18 and 40 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- (previous) pathology of the joints, ligaments or tendons of the thumb
